alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Livingston; Monroe; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 7:58PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Wyoming, northwestern Livingston, southeastern Genesee and southwestern Monroe Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 756 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking several growing thunderstorms, all moving east at 25 to 30 mph. The strongest storm at 755 PM EDT was near Pavilion. Another developing cell was just south of Wyoming and one near Oakfield. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Batavia, Geneseo, Letchworth State Park, Le Roy, Perry, Mount Morris, Pavilion, Caledonia, Riga, York, Stafford, Covington, Bergen, Leicester, Wyoming, East Bethany, Perry Center, Bethany Center, Silver Lake and Sonyea. This includes the following highways... Interstate 390 near exit 7. Interstate 90 between exits 48 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
